alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 11:53AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow showers will affect southeastern Coos... eastern Grafton and Carroll Counties... At 1152 AM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was along a line extending from 13 miles east of Pinkham Notch to Haverhill...and moving southeast AT 25 MPH. Locations impacted include... Conway, Bethlehem, Lincoln, Moultonborough, Plymouth, Ossipee, Haverhill, Holderness, Ashland, Effingham, Franconia, Groton, Woodstock, Tamworth, Pinkham Notch, Sandwich, Mount Washington, Piermont, Carroll, and Gorham. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 78 and 116. This also includes... Crawford Notch State Park, Franconia Notch, Mount Moosilauke, Rumney Rocks, and Cannon Mountain. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter mile in this area of heavy snow showers. * Sudden and brief snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible in this area of heavy snow showers. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.

area.areaDesc: Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton
